I want them to have some involvement in the game's story. Blue being the guy whos stalking you through the whole game. Lance helping you beat up Team Rocket. Cynthia going into the distortion world with you. More than like two fucking cutscenes.

I want a cool design that looks like clothes/hair/etc that a human being might actually wear. Steven and Geeta are wearing basically a suit, Alder is basically wearing a poncho and trousers. They're good. Iris's hair is insanely long and complicated and her dress is so big and poofy, she should be tripping and getting snagged on stuff constantly. I don't even know where to start with Wallace. I have a hard time suspending my disbelief.

I don't want the game to tell me how powerful they are or how impossible it is to defeat them, because I know that as a video game every obstacle inside it is intended to be overcome by the player. Tell me they're the strongest trainer in the region, sure, but don't act like I'm supposed to be in awe over their power when they're just a video game boss.

I also like to see some amount of them acting like an authority figure, maybe bossing around a gym leader or elite four member, something like that. Like, when the elder in the dragon den threatened to Clair that he would get Lance involved if she didn't hand out the gym badge? I like the game to treat the champion like an authority figure.

Also gotta have good music. Controversial opinion but Cynthia's theme doesn't do it for me. Most games I've liked the villain theme better than the theme(s) associated with the champion.

Also being a hot mommy who can extract my coom is a bonus, but not required

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
Classes were cancelled so... Done!
>Koga
Was swept by Machamp with Earthquake, Weezing survived but decided to eat an X-attack.
>Sabrina
Twineedle on Kadabra, set up Agility on Mr.Mime as it set up a Light Screen, then Beedrill proceeds to sweep with Twineedle. Nice.
>Blaine
Another Earthquake sweep, Arcanine survived and Toke Down'd Machamp twice.
>Giovanni
Lead with Fearow thinking the lead was Dugtrio, had to swap into Dragonair on a Stomp, proceeded to sweep the whole lot with Ice Beam. Nido's survived but both used Tackle... Red and Blue gyms are dumb.

>Lorelei
Machamp is a champ, Rock Slide and Low Kick dealt with everyone but Lapras who got a nasty hit in with Hydro Pump.
Swapped to Fearow and got clapped with another Hydro Pump. Swap again to Arbok on a miss, Dig activates a Super Potion and then two Acid's take Lapras down as it hits a Confuse Ray and a Blizzard. Closer than I would've liked.

>Bruno
Arbok Mega Drains, Digs, and Acids through everyone save for Machamp. I swap for an honor battle and Strength Bruno's Machamp down.

>Agatha
Arbok Digs through Gengar. Golbat forces a switch to Fearow on a Wing Attack and Double-Edge takes down Golbat and Drill Peck deals with Haunter. I swap to Arbok on Arbok and Dig through it and the incoming Gengar.

>Lance
An absolute sweep with Dragonite, Boltbeam is unstoppable

>Rival
Fearow two shots Pidgeot as it struggles to do damage, Alakazam gets outsped and taken out with a Double-Edge.
On Rhydon I swap to Machamp and take it down with two Earthquakes as it Hits a nasty 5-hit Fury Attack and a Leer, Arcanine goes down to an Earthquake.
Swap to Beedrill on Exeggutor and get hit with Hypnosis, Beedrill and Arbok both get worn down by bad sleep luck, Charizard burns up the palmtree.
Blastoise comes out and I swap to Mahcmap ona withdraw and Deal some nice damage with EQ but I'm low, I swap Dragonite on a Hydro Pump... thank god... and Thunderbolt for the win.

Thunder from Gengar on Gyrados after two misses on both sides, a Hypnosis on Dragonair and then Blizzard sweep with Starmie.

posts.name: Anonymous

>>52640431
Tera definitely isn't getting banned.
Over 60% of players need to agree in order to take any tiering action at all, and even the famously ban-loving tournament players are only barely over 60% agreement that anything should be done at all.
And the majority of players who do think tiering action is required think it just needs to be restricted, not outright banned. Not even half of the tourneyfags who think tiering action is required think it should be a ban.
So even if the vote does manage to swing in favor of action, banning is unlikely.

They're probably just going to do what VGC is doing and show tera types at team preview.
I don't like that idea and think it'll just make it more of a "rich gets richer" mechanic, but it seems like the most likely option.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52587470
Only rich mulch boosts your yield. If you meant using boost mulch to get berries faster, then rich mulch is still better for that purpose since it doubles your yield (as opposed to boost mulch making your crops grow 1.5 faster), you only have to use it once per berry (while in most cases a berry will need multiple uses of boost mulch), and only costs double the price of boost mulch.

Ideally you want to use both if possible, as long as you can cover the cost in FP.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52634766
>umbreon has a psa10 pop of over 2000 cards
>zard is up huge from pre-2019 prices
>umbreon started high and only went higher

Zard is following a simple trend of demand driving a hype bubble followed by a price retraction to a new price floor significantly above where it was before. It's price is driven by true demand and scarcity.

Umbreon is following a classic hype bubble trend. It has no scarcity and its price is only fueled by people feeling that they will be missing out on it as it rises further, creating a self fulfilling prophecy. While demand is a greater driver off price than supply, neither is the driver of umbreon's price. Umbreon's price is purely driven by hype and is completely artificial. As such it is unsustainable and will collapse eventually. It's not a matter of "if" but "when"
It may not go down tomorrow, or next week or next month, but it will. Once people realize how many are out there it will go down. Once people realize that there's no reason to pay $550 for a card with >2000 psa10s, it will go down. But that can take a while.

Lastly, evolving skies is the ONLY outlier among modern. Using umbreon as an example is not really proving anything. There will always be exceptions.

Unpopular oppinion but the fighting system of the first gen was the best. The fact that init would increase crit rate and the TMs you could learn made a much better fighting experience. Also there was never a bigger challenge than pokemon yellow (ok maybe all symbols in emerald).

In my eyes they fucked up by "balancing" every fkn type to be one and the same shit. Why do you need a 120 special bug move? Bugs where never ment to be special hitters. Also the ratio of types to attacks where more original. You had a dragon and he was a dragon type and you had a ghost he was a ghost type. Today you have 20+ ghosts and they all look the same and know similar movesets. There was also no "bad" pokemon in gen1 because you could learn KO attacks as tms.

The thing back then was just the challange the pokemon where not that similar you hat to think which pokemon has which move today it seems like everyone knows every move and can learn 80+ attacks.

I just cant get over the low difficulty of newer gens its just to easy. Its the good games they dont make them these days... *sip*

>>52647585
As someone that plays stall and bulky offense on the regular let me clarify, HO is all about breaking another player core and reach a position where they can't prevent further fainting, you do this by double switching, turning, or sacking to always maintain tempo

Stall is all about reaching a situation in which your opponent can't do jackshit because his most threatening Pokémon can't switch in safely or they already lost it and can't answer your sweeper/tank/pivot

TLDR stall is about taking away the other player wincon, it's the reason why trapping is a stall thing while hazards are often seen as offense main game plan early

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52647442
Tournament players.
Ladder players hate stall because on the ladder, you just have to win more than you lose and win as much as possible. So faster and more offensive playstyles are preferred, even if they're riskier. Although once you reach the really high ladder, players will change from trying to obtain their position to defending their position and using more defensive teams.
In tournaments, you want to never lose at all. So the extremely safe and slow playstyles are preferred.
This is also why they hate RNG so much. If you play a ton of ladder matches, the RNG evens out. In tourney matches, one bad bit of RNG ends your run.

The truth is that it was never a stall bias, but a tourneyfag bias. The two intersect a lot, but not perfectly. See the trapping and evasion bans.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
Got a shiny dusk lycanroc in 2 tries, spent more time finding the right time to set the switch to than hunting, got a random midnight lycanroc just doing the 60kills before it.
if anyone else wants to do it
>get lycanroc outbreak (reset outbreaks in top right map, kill 60 and save
>turn off game, change your system clock in increments (a day is like 36 mins apparently, 72 for day/night) and reload the game until you find the transition from day>night, change the time a few mins at a time until you find dusk lycanroc's spawn time (picnic to reset spawns when you load in), set it about 2mins before their spawn time (enough time to load the game and make a sandwhich) and remember that time cause you gotta reset back to it after every try, you have ~3min window to try for it before it switches to midnight form

>>52637678
It's to do with the fact that (most) Ghosts disappear during the day, with Flutter mane being the only Ghost in the entire pool of AZ's caves (not including the ruins with Houndstone, but that's why you don't go there)
The game will forcibly spawn them due to Ghost Encounter 3, then forcibly despawn them because they're not supposed to exist during the day - shinies however seem to be exempt from this rule
There doesn't seem to be any other ways to get this to work though, or nobody's willing to test it out

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52638973
For Flutter mane, there's the usual trick.
For all the Paradoxes that spawn underground, there's a specific spot in the underground past station 4 where a rock is on one of the giant crystal formations - if you stand on the crystal near the rock then Pokemon will only spawn ontop of that rock making it easy to see all 15 spawns at once and just walk a few steps forward/backwards to reroll.
For Valiant you can use Fairy and go to the underground area instead of the usual cave.
For Roaring Moon, using auto-battles and slowly walking around to prevent Houndstones from spawning.
Sandy, Thorns and the Volcaronas are just running around or auto-battling.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
I posted >>52621185 a couple days ago, speaking of my horrible experience with the Azumarill that decided to Double Edge at 1 HP and how I had forgotten to turn off autosave (RIP Sodapop Sr).

Today I decided I had it in my heart to try again, and so I triple checked that autosave was off, flew back to Casseroya, saved, and made my sandwich.

The first time 30 minutes was a total bust, and so I reset, made a new sandwich, and tried again.

Within 8 minutes I saw the telltale seafoam green of a shiny Marill, saved, and then caught her in a Dive Ball on my first try. Her name is Sodapop Jr in honor of the fallen.

As I still had 22 minutes left on my buff, I decided to try searching for shiny Iron Valiant again, so I flew to Area Zero and headed to Research Station 3 to the cave.

As some guy on YouTube said, this hunt is annoying because a lot of Greavard packs spawn no matter what sparkling power you have, and they are also difficult to see to avoid, with only their lil white candles with purple flames sticking out of the ground. I was pretty good at avoiding them, and I was continuing another lap when I spotted something weird.

Was that a yellow candle?

I saved again, and sure enough, it was a shiny Greavard-- my first full odds (well, I have the shiny charm, but still) shiny in at least half a decade!

I caught him in a Premier Ball (nothing I had matches that brownish yellow) and named him Bone Daddy.

When I had less than 10 minutes left on the timer, I FINALLY found my Iron Valiant. I saved, and it only took two tries to catch it in a Dream Ball. I named him Zireael.

My autism dictates that if I catch a Shiny, it's earned a permanent place on my team. So now I have perhaps the worst-balanced squad in the game. Oh well, it's a problem I'm happy to have!

I'm currently waiting for it to turn night time in game so Bone Daddy can evolve, so I'm wasting time taking cute picnic pics.

This is the process my dude:

>find an outbreak of the mon you want (either by luck or by uping the day 1 by one on the console clock)
>save the fucking game with autosave off
>beat 60 of the mon you want
>make a sandwich of the sparkling power needed
>find an area not to close not to far where you can have a clear view of the pokemons that spawn
>use the "picnic" and cancel it instanly to reset all pokemons around you

You're encouraged to post prompts, i.e. short snippets or greentext sequences describing your ideas. You can also expand on prompts posted by others. If writing an entire story from start to finish feels too daunting, this is a way to get started.

>I have this idea about [event/technology/...]
Feel free to post your thoughts about how specific parts of the Pokémon world function as well. Worldbuilding is always welcome.

>Can I add a fic I wrote to the catalog?
Check the catalog for the submission link. Fill out the form with all the necessary information and it will be submitted for review automatically.

We're also looking to collect ideas for fanfics as a resource for stumped writers. Feel free to throw an idea out there; someone may choose to use it themselves!

>>52601513
There are fightscene breakdowns on youtube, watch them.

There’s a wealth of MMA analysis and guides, of weapons fighting tips, of tactics in war.

There’s pokemon showdown and a ton of guides on competitive battling, the meat of those are about outsmarting your opponent. You can incorporate literally any of this material, though dont get too bogged down by game mechanic or tier list bullshit.

You probably have seen, maybe read, some good fightscenes through your life. Watch them again with an analytical mind and figure out how to translate what works into your format.

And for the love of god, if you’re doing this to write well dont try to become an expert on all this infinite amount of material. Have a loose idea on what sort of feeling you want for the fight or the concept of it, and then direct your research based on that specifically to start building that one fightscene. Make loose notes and a basic timeframe as you go, otherwise you’ll get lost in the sauce and just have unwritten ideas or be researching forever.

>If you're following the current gold-digger meme, then you have her start out by wedging herself into his life post-champ, posing as wanting to "watch out for him, in case some old friends of his try to take advantage of his newfound fame and status" when, of course, she's doing so just to isolate him for herself to do just that, which he obliviously accepts; however, over time of "borrowing" money and basking in the benefits of being a famous person's gf and basically being royalty in Alola because of it, his relentless positivity makes her actually fall for him, first by making her more protective of his dumbass self, to the point where she starts to feel guilty for taking advantage of his trust and friendship before, and later taken in by his uncanny ability to unintentionally be really, really smooth with words, saying things that, to him, aren't romantic phrases, but to the listener, are (consider looking at the High Touch! doujin in Dawn General for examples of this).

That said, here's an angle you can take, because, funny enough, the two actually have an amusing dynamic to them for a ship that fits their characters, if you can capture it: One is a total Pokénut who is endlessly open and willing to try new things whereas the other is more reserved, only has a surface level interest in Pokémon, and is often unnerved by the other's extreme extroversion; the fact that both get along despite being polar opposites in personality and mood makes for great potential dynamics that grounds the both of them into a balance. And in that "balance," you have your ship.

Back again. Here is what I came up with.
It was the morning of his 16th birthday. Kai was hopeful that his parents would finally let him have a Pokémon and go off on his own to challenge gyms. Ever since he was 10 he loved watching trainers battle on TV, and in his spare time he would head out into the forest to observe the Pokémon.

“Good morning” He said to his parents, who were preoccupied with making breakfast. Still groggy from just rolling out of bed, and a little annoyed he was woken by the banging of pots and pans. He didn’t let it show, he was thankful for his parents for going out of the way to make a meal.

His parents were never thrilled with the idea of their son being a trainer. They had thought it would be a passing phase he would eventually grow out of. It’s been 6 years since he said “I want to be a trainer!”

Mom and Dad were in the kitchen getting breakfast ready. An unusual sight for this household, they were usually too busy to make a proper meal in the morning.

“Good morning, Happy birthday” Dad replied.

“Morning” Said mom, who was too preoccupied with something on the stove to give a full response.

“Why don’t you get yourself fully dressed and ready so we can start celebrating” Dad said. “By the time you’re back down breakfast will be ready and we can all sit down together.” Said dad.

The kitchen was alive with the sounds of a full meal in the works, food sizzling, kitchenware clanging and banging.

“Finally, a proper breakfast” Kai thought. He loved his Mother’s cooking, she’s a very talented cook, but she doesn’t flex her skills very often, or at least not as often as Kai would like.

“Maya should be here soon with your first gift, so make sure you’re presentable.” Added Mom. “We went through hell and high water to get it.” Said mom, turning away from the stove and acknowledging him fully for the first time.

“Sure thing Mom”

1/2.

They didn’t see the glamor in being a trainer, and wanted their son to focus his energy on trying to get a regular job the same way they did.

Mom and Dad were in the kitchen getting breakfast ready. An unusual sight for this household, they were usually too busy to make a proper meal in the morning.

“Good morning, Happy birthday” Dad replied.

“Finally, a proper breakfast” Kai thought. He loved his Mother’s cooking, she’s a very talented cook, but she doesn’t flex her skills very often, or at least not as often as Kai would like.

He eagerly raced up the stairs to get himself ready. He knew that his parents had capitulated in their struggle to get him to give up on being a trainer. He knew because Maya was involved. Maya was his next door neighbor, she moved here from Unova 8 years ago with her Father. She was outgoing, and ambitious, but sometimes overbearing. Most importantly, Maya was a very talented trainer, and already had her first badge from Oreburgh City. That’s how Kai new his parents had changed their mind - if Maya was involved Pokémon were involved.

Kai and Maya were friends of circumstance, despite Kai being put off buy her general disagreeableness, their close proximity to one another essentially forced them to get along. It wasn’t all bad though, Maya would often take him along to watch her battle, other trainers or just wild Pokémon, which he absolutely loved doing. Watching Maya battle was a sight to behold, she was always totally in control of the field. Her battle vs Roark even made it into the highlight reel on T.V

Kai hurriedly got ready, he knew breakfast was almost ready and he didn’t want to keep his parents waiting since they made an extra effort to make him breakfast. He headed back downstairs as his parents were setting three places at the table.

“Thanks for doing this guys, It means a lot to me” Kai said.

“No problem sweetie” replied mom

“Is there anything you need me to do?”

“Nope! Just sit tight, everything is almost ready.”

Finally the chaotic noise of the kitchen ceased and was replaced with Mom quietly but carefully setting the table. Making sure every knife, fork, spoon, glass, plate, serving plate, etc. is in the proper place. Mom had a way of getting totally absorbed into what she was doing.

The peace was suddenly interrupted by the door slamming open

“Where’s the birthday boy, he’s gonna LOVE the gift I got him!”

Maya’s here.

The loud entry snapped Mom out of her focus. She was annoyed even more by Maya saying she alone got the gift. While it was technically true, Mom and Dad had made an agreement with Maya that she would say it was a gift from everyone. She was also here 40 minutes early.

“Welcome Maya! So good to see you! Kai, go help with her coat and I’ll run and set another place at the table for her.” Mom was very good at hiding whenever she was annoyed or upset.

Kai got up and helped her as instructed.

“Hey, thanks for coming” He said as he was helping with her jacket. He didn’t want to be so forward as to ask about the gift, but it was all that was on his mind.

“Yeah I wouldn’t miss this day for the world, let me keep my jacket” She said, brushing him off “I wanna show you your gift quickly, but act like it’s a surprise when I show you later in front of them”

The two of them stepped outside quickly. The chilly fall air was nipping at their cheeks. Maya reached into her bag and pulled out a pokeball.

“No way, are you serious?” Asked Kai.

“Yes!” Maya released the Pokémon, and a starly emerged, and began nervously flying around. “Happy birthday! He’s all yours, just be careful, he’s still not used to being in a pokeball so be extra gentle with him. He’ll warm up to you in a few days.” She recalled the starly before he could fly too far away.

2.5/3

Well, let's think about what dragons are in-universe: rare, powerful but difficult to train, dangerous. There's also not a lot of dragon trainers around in the game, most of the time you find them in secluded areas and late-game areas.

In the past training dragons was probably a much more dangerous, but probably more impactful thing to do in case of wars or conflict. Since it's so hard to do, it checks out that the people who could do it would band together and kinda flex their techniques and power. It's just a somewhat rare talent so it makes sense that it'd be passed down a family or small group.

Also since it's a japanese series they keep the whole lineage and tradition thing going very heavily

>>52633033
>>52633484
Check'd. First time we actually see a broken limb is with Rock Tomb, and it does shock Lee at the time. I don't mind Pokemon being a bit gorier with these sorts of fights, but I do have two objections.
>Lee gets over the savagery of these fights in no time
Much ado was made about whether he could stand to see his Vulpix get hurt, but after a few weeks of intense battling it hardly affects him at all. This process should have been much more gradual. Kids in that world can stand it because they grow up watching it like with Romans and gladiatorial games, but Lee is not only a modern American, but a zookeeper. Pitting pseudo-animals in vicious fights should make him uncomfortable to his core.
>The idea of pokemon dying in a fight is so foreign that war footage gets scrubbed off the internet
Despite pokemon pulling out the stops and using fangs, claws, poison, rocks, fire, and everything else in fights, it's implied there are NEVER any accidental casualties. I don't want the fic to be "ooh so grimdark and edgy, everyone can die!" but if you start out the story with people violently dying, then there should be at least a risk of something like that happening to a beloved pokemon. For comparison, professional boxers are limited to punching with padded gloves, with plenty of set rules, and casualties still happen sometimes. Even if pokemon are "stupid durable" that should be a sad risk of the sport.

>But why the QQ update then?
Haven't finished my re-read on the QQ thread, but cross-posting is pretty normal in this particular community. SpaceBattles is the most popular, QuestionableQuesting was created independently but happened to coincide with SB having a wave of porn ban enforcement so it picked up a solid user base, and Sufficient Velocity was made when SB's server hardware was physically breaking down AND a blowup over a staff member being fired underhandedly so for several years people cross-posted just in case SB suffered total data loss.

Then there's the cluster of weird-ass spinoffs like the one made by the stalker who impersonated an SB mod on QQ, the one made by the OTHER stalker who's an ultra-far-left lunatic, the Luxury Gay Space Communist's "Free Speech Zone" that has closed because the owner doxxed himself on KiwiFarms (where he still posts...), and TheSietch founded by some ex-staff over conservative witch-hunting.

Plus the old basically-dead rival StarDestroyer.net, the significant but not STRONG overlap with AlternateHistory.com that's run by literally three people with some incredibly strange forum culture as a result of the catastrophic understaffing, and the consequences of being the spawning grounds of several weird fandoms.

When people talk retarded Versus bullshit, it probably goes back to SB. When people talk Familiar of Zero fanfiction, it probably goes back to SB. When people talk about WildBow's Worm, it probably goes back to SB. When people talk Planetary Annihilation Self-Inserts, it probably goes back to SB. The site is older than 4chan, seeing some absolutely absurd political shifts in lurching to the modern norms.

>>52646244
When questioning how the Pokemon world works, always remember that monopolization of force is a keystone of modern civilization wholly inapplicable to it due to the titular creatures. As is large-scale natural resource exploitation. By extension of these two, and readily apparent from the series, there's sod-all inter-city connectivity.

So functionally speaking, there shouldn't be a Regional military to be part of. The common defense is the general population of Trainers and Pokemon, whether that be foreign invasion or local unrest, and there's not enough connection for people to care much about "their Region". See Ash typically referring to being from Pallet Town, rarely if ever Kanto.

This is why all the psychopaths look for 670+ BST Legendaries. Because you NEED single creatures able to brute-force the Champion and roll over dozens of "normal" Trainers without pause to get anywhere with unwanted change, ON TOP OF the higher-ups' personal teams not being far from the Champion's and Elites'.

>*Research Analysis: BC-001
>From: Professor Nils Odurt

Through my analysis and documentation, I have stumbled upon a horrific mutation that seems to come from Shroomish living too long in bogs and swamps. It seems to have begun swelling in mass, but instead of becoming a Breloom, it just melts into itself. It's claws are enormous, but it has lost most of its original speed and physical strength. We've come to call it Breconsume for now.

It's a very tenacious and terrifying predator, preferring to camouflage itself in the dead surrounding plant matter of its environment. Prey that comes within its reach is often hooked by its massive claws and swallowed whole. The few that can escape are often drenched in toxic spores and poisonous fluids that quickly deprive them of stamina and strength. It is a patient hunter, one that stalks its prey before enveloping it whole. I've taken some samples of its feedings and residue left behind. I had to capture one that was stalking me, I have no clue if they can be properly tamed, but I feel a little excited to have one in my possession. I'll provide further documentation on the subject later and how it handles captivity compared to wild ones.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52606356
Nils is a Norwegian boys name that means "People of victory" and at the time when we were plotting on making a region that is antagonistic and polar opposite of Zirca, I thought it was a very appropriate name that someone would probably name their kid with. I even thought that his dad could have been a veteran from either that war or one prior to it.

Odurt is based on the Norwegian word for "Water Hemlock" since I wanted him to be themed around poisonous things that are used in medicine. I thought about either that, Macula, or just Hemlock. The latter one seemed too on the nose. Macula almost became his middle name, but I stuck with Nils Odurt since it was simple and easy to remember.

>>52606311
(For shits and grins)
>Research Analysis: ST-001
>From: Nils Odurt

Normally, the Alolan Morelull and Shiinotic are a Grass/Fairy type Pokemon. Known for their vibrant luminescence and their ability to produce spores and lights that induce sleep on travelers. In the region of Valkha, I've noticed a peculiarity that has formed in this region's variant of them. Nocturnal in nature, they live primarily in thick and dense forests, hiding until sunset where they come out.

These type of Shiinotic are much more dimly luminescent than their Alolan relatives, difficult to make out with the naked eye, but it seems to be an evolutionary adaptation to their environment. Despite this, they still glow under ultraviolet light, more florescent than bio-luminescence. They have a distinct red coloration to their caps, resembling witches hats and their bodies are a light brown. They seem to react to hostile threats by radiating a sort of aura that seems to affect the minds of their enemies. It drains them of their energy, they become lethargic and depressed the longer they stay within the area of influence of these Shiinotic. Almost like it's sapping away all the positive energy they have, and the Shiinotic become much more active after such encounters. They even gather and dance with each other in clearings, a strange dance that I can't seem to describe with words alone.

I must admit that being here leaves me feeling rather hesitant and fearful. I've heard from locals in a neighboring town about these woods being home to dark spirits and curses because of their history. I can't confirm that these are anything more than superstitious rumors, but the presence of ghost Pokemon and other creatures that seem to frequent such locations are prevalent here as well. I've taken to capturing a Valkhan Morelull and Shiinotic for further research.

I would like to post myself here in Valkha for now as this place utterly fascinates me to no end.

>>52611840

>Research Analysis: LL-001
>From: Nils Odurt

The further north that I go, the more things seem to change in terms of adaptation. I wouldn't have expected to see Shroomish up here, but they've seemed to develop a sort of adaptation even in the freezing temperatures high up in Valkha.

You would think Pokemon like Shroomish would be ill-fit to endure the snow and frost. The adaptation seems to stem from them eating a certain type of lichen that thrives up here. It is in their regular consumption of this fauna that they begin to undergo an evolutionary change. They develop thick lichenous growths, it covers their mantle and most of their body like a hair of sorts. Arms are much stronger than their Breloom counterparts, A single claw on each arm, thick and short with a hooked end.

They seem to be much more prone to initiating combat against a threat than their tropical brethren. Lost a lot of their capacity to use spores in combat, instead they relentlessly barrage their opponents with terrible slashes and piercing strikes with their fists. It is amazing just how fast they seem to move, a strange elegance it's almost like they dance around their opponent. Not a lot of stamina in them though, it might be because of the fact that they burn through energy faster than they can produce it. If they can't defeat their opponent quickly, they seem to use their tails as a scoop to gather up a large amount of snow to blind their opponent before fleeing.

Due to the vast change in appearance and temperament between them and Breloom, it would be wise to assume they are a distinct divergent evolution. I've taken to calling them "Lavloom", but the name is more for my own personal recording purposes and fully open to change if need be. I managed to catch one in battle, a miracle if anything else. It along with the samples I've gathered will be sent to you for further analysis.

>>52615949
>Research Analysis: V-SS-001
>From: Nils Odurt

Near the western shores of Valkha, I've discovered a series of wetlands and marshes that dot throughout the area. It is in one of these areas that I've discovered a strange variant of Kantoian Sandshrew/Sandslash. Their hide takes on the qualities of their environment, coated and tinted from the algae and bog debris. This seems to be a defensive adaptation that lets them avoid predation in return. Due to limited options, they seem to have evolved piscivorious traits along with the insectivore traits of their Kantoian relatives. Sharp harpoon-like tail, specialized hands that end with three fingers that end with long claws with grooves that easily pierce into the slippery hide of their aquatic. Webbing between their fingers gives them great locomotion in the water, and also lets them dig easily into the marshland mud.

The back of the Valkhan Sandslash has rather impressive sharpened scales; thick, but they have extraordinary flexibility to move around their territory. From what I've seen, they are normally adverse to interacting with others, they are much more inclined to hiding if the option to run is provided. Otherwise, they will react aggressively, their serrated claws can shred flesh and the tip of their tail seems perfectly suited for piercing thick hides and scales. From what I've seen, when they are pressured into combat, they will not stop until their aggressor is rendered incapacitated or dead.

That said, I have acquired samples along with a Valkhan Sandslash. They will be sent to you for further examination. Fighting one was difficult enough, especially with the difficult terrain. You try to engage in battle with one in mud that goes up to your hips.

((I had to shift the idea of how their hands and feet looked because for the sake of locomotion in water, they really should have webbed hands and feet. I figured with webbed hands that end in serrated claws would be perfect.))

Armaldo is more of a utility Pokemon, known for its Knock Off and Rapid Spin (as well as set up moves), so it's definitely a shitmon in terms of its in game set, but Claydol is still very good even in Steven's hands. Screens are very strong and can turn a 1HKO or 2HKO into a 3HKO or 4HKO, especially on dangerous Pokemon like Metagross. STAB EQ even off of its mediocre attack stat is still very dangerous

>Gastrodon

[cont] To elaborate
>Catch all the pokemon
>You must have defeated or caught Mewtwo,a self-proclaimed pokemon master
>You must defeat all elite 4 members and by extension win each region's conference
>You must become a champion
>You must become a member of the pokemon league
>You must not lose as a champion when you are defending your title
>You must have won a world-class tournament.
>You must have won a master-class tournament.
Which the only things Ash has left to do is
>Catch all the pokemon
>Defeat all elite 4 members
>win all conferences
>Don't lose when defending the title
There is also defeat/catch mewtwo, but Ash may have defeated mewtwo just in an indirect method.
A lot of these various conditions are either from the main anime, games, books, comics, etc.
Some source material states that elite 4 members like Lorelei are considered pokemon masters.
Legend of Thunder has Marina refer to Lance as a pokemon master.
In some source material, a pokemon master is just an elite trainer.

Personally speaking I'd be willing to put more money into the game is Niantic presented real value for money, but they rarely do.
They're clearly desperate with the number of paid events they've been putting in lately, and gutting the value of the in-game boxes that can potentially be earned entirely free by earning coins.

They need to consider adding a subscription model with tangible, good value bonuses.
What could they even conceivably add though?
Say, for a $5/month deal you could get things like...
>+1 Candy on all Pokémon captures (boosted by berries / event bonuses)
>+50 stardust on all Pokémon captures (boosted by weather / star piece / event bonuses)
>+10% XP gain on Pokemon captures (boosted by lucky egg / event bonuses)
>Improved odds of receiving candy XL on Pokémon captures
>Subscribers-only monthly research tasks
>A secondary infinite incubator for as long as you remain subscribed
>3 additional bonus egg spaces for as long as you remain subscribed
>+5 Premier Balls when catching Pokémon after a raid battle or Go Rocket battle
>One Master Ball a month, must be used during that month
>Earn up to 100 coins per day when Pokémon are knocked out of gyms
>Alternatively, a 10% coins discount on all in-game items and boxes
>One additional free (orange) raid pass per day
>One additional special trade per day or 50 additional standard trades per day

Maybe that would be generous to offer ALL that for $5/month, Niantic would probably offer less for $10 a month.
But, they need to offer things that people genuinely care about, which they often don't.

posts.name: Anonymous

>>52644593
It's a good deal, lately most of the in-game purchases have been incredibly poor value.

They're not essential though. Much of the game is about knowing when to use your premium items.
Save premium passes for high-value raids like Mewtwo or good attackers (upcoming Cobalion raids won't be worth it).
Save incubators for egg focused events with good hatches available.
Save lucky eggs for community days that offer 3x catch XP (this weekend only offers 2x catch XP), or for when you go best friends with someone (100k XP is doubled to 200k) AND you can mass-evolve 80+ Pokémon in that half hour.

*A few moments later*
>Palafin: The people I just cannot stand are Scovillain and- (low frequency shock) ooowwww
>Meowscarada: (laughing) Palafin! Palafin, come back! (he fell to the side out of pain)
*On a more recent radio show, this is the conversation that flowed between Scovillain and Meowscarada*
>Scovillain (Red head): “I still want the other villains to come here.”
>Meowscarada: “Me too.”
>Scovillain (Green head): “I want to bring those who couldn’t come.”
>Meowscarada: “Yeah.”
>Scovillain (Red head): “Didn’t Malamar and Kingambit come already?”
>Meowscarada: “They haven’t”
>Scovillain (Green head): "I want them to come. The Superhero of Paldea doesn’t need to, though. (laughs)“

This thread is for the growth of artists and those who draw for fun. If you're going to give critique, please do it constructively. Rude or blunt critiques won't help anybody.

Requesters are free to request what they wish, but avoid bumping your request every half hour as it's only going to put people off; try giving it a few hours or more.

Please provide references in ONE image, especially when requesting something outside of the Pokémon universe. If you request something from the old Drawthread or a separate thread, COPY & PASTE the actual request instead of posting a link.

Also, be mindful that requests are done at the discretion of the artists, not on a first come first serve basis.

Please remember to save any piece of art you like from these threads, as we may never know when the archive will start deleting images again. Artists can and are recommended to post their works on other outlets for archival purposes.

posts.com:
I wanna talk about visuals for a sec.

>Tera
The worst looking ones. Still hate how stupid those huge ass Tera crowns look. Not a single pokemon looks good wearing those retarded crowns because they're so big and clunky.

>Z moves
Aside the dumb Jojo poses, the moves themselves are a mixed bag. Most of the exclusive z moves look great. Like ultra necrozma's Light That Burns The Sky being a literal nuke.
But a lot of the regular Type-based z moves can look really fucking lazy, because the pokemon remain in their basic idle animations during the attacks.
Like the psychic z move Shattered Psyche has the opposing pokemon being smacked around, but it's jarring to see them remain idle and acting unfazed.

>Dynamax
Lazy. Their 3d models are just scaled up and have red fart clouds around them.
>Gmax
The red fart clouds are still there, but at least the pokemon change into new forms. Can't say that I like many of the new designs though.
I just think skyscraper kaiju sized mons don't really belong in a pokemon game and feel out of place. Not to mention that Gmax mons generally look overdesigned and overcomplicated.

>Megas
The best looking ones. For the most part, the new designs genuinely feel like what these pokemon's next evolutions would actually look like.
But a few of the mega designs are stinkers imo. Some just look inferior to their regular forms. Like Lati@s, Aggron, Blastoise, etc. They can't all be winners, I guess.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52640294
For me, from best to worst, it's
>Tera-Type
I'm actually going to miss this mechanic going forward. It's a mechanic that can be used on any pokemon, and without taking up a held item slot, meaning that
1: you don't have to use game freak's favorites
2: you don't have to build a member around the assumption that it will use tera-type, but you can still build it with the assumption that it may.
3: you can build multiple pokemon in your team around this mechanic and pop it depending on what the situation actually calls for
Additionally it's not strong by way of inflating the numbers, it's strong by introducing flexibility. Changing type almost always has both upsides and downsides.
>Z-Moves
I mostly like this for the way it interacts with status moves, attacking Z-moves never did anything for me. Having to use a held item also means that engaging with the mechanic requires you to pick a 'mon and form their entire build around the item, and the fact that you can only use 1 per fight heavily discourages packing multiple. Basically Z-moves are just introducing more ways to build 'mons, but they get used very linearly when the fight actually starts for the most part.
>Dynamax
It's just braindead, you become unstoppable for 3 turns, the only interesting effect this had on the game was making weather and terrain way easier to set. I think field conditions are a good mechanic, but the rest of this mechanic is cancer.
>Megas
Nearly all of the designs were awful, it's the only gimmick to be exclusive to a whitelist of popular 'mons, it requires an item, you can only build one member of your team around the mechanic, there's no downside beyond item slot and the rare base stat decrease (which tended to be minor anyway). The worst part of all is that some of the only good designs were on 'mons that really just needed proper evolutions. This Banette evolution is sick as fuck and I'll never be allowed to use it again.

Hoenn? It's one of 15 water routes that are the exact same.
Sinnoh? Mostly a straight line. Also a generic water route, but at least there's not so many in the game.
Unova? Specifically, BW2, since you already 'covered' BW. It's about twice the size of the BW one, and is kind of overwhelming. It does have liberal use of HMs, which sucks, but it's all optional, I think.
Kalos? The main pathway is even shorter than BW1, but the optional areas are pretty decent.
Alola? Honestly not sure what to call the final route here.
Galar? Mostly a straight line.

the actual core gameplay and mechanics are pretty dated and gets repetitive. still using the same system all the way back in 98. going from exploration to battle encounter screen breaks the game's flow.
SV does a better job making the transition smoother. but PLA almost downright perfects it. battles are quick and snappy while you can also run to your next destination and not even bother looking at the battle happening behind you. the only thing that really sets apart pokemon from other rpgs is basically huge options of team-building but the actual pokemon units themselves only having an ability and 4 options for moves at a time is still a bit limited. look over at persona where it's also about collecting units you can use but you can mix and match attacking moves, passive skills, statuses, etc. etc.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52645657
The chess motif is just localization fanfic. The line are just based on samurai.

Pawniard is called "Komatana" which is a mix of "komagire" (cut into small pieces) and "katana)
Bisharp is "Kirikizan" which is a mix of "kirikizamu" or to mince, and "zan" which means to cut, in reference to cutting down an enemy.
And Kingambit is "Dodogezan", combining "dogeza" which is to apologize or prostrate, and the aforementioned "zan". Because that's pretty much what its signature move Kowtow Cleave is.

I assume the chess motif comes from a misunderstanding. "Koma" is what the pieces in Shogi are called, and Pokemon names are only in katakana, not kanji, so only the pronunciation is known and not the meaning.
It's not 100% out of the question that there was Shogi inspiration, but there's no visual indication of it whatsoever.

posts.com:
I've actually been wondering the same thing. Being a girl who's weirdly obsessed with you and stalks you to "coincidentally meet you" at gyms is the obvious answer and I'm no exception to liking that. But I also think it's cool how she's already a champion and has to force herself to hold back but sometimes gets too excited and needs a reminder.

She really just wants to help you get strong enough to kick her ass because she's obsessed with competition and growth. Like a doting big sister with a one-track-mind. She's not looking up to you while straggling behind, she wants you to be able to keep up with her and surpass her

The last few rivals have just been annoying losers who know they're beneath you and worship you, only hanging around you to react to stuff for you. Their best moments were at the very last second when Hau actually got frustrated at losing, and when Hop finally accepted that he was born to be a fag and gave up on battling for a new goal. They're also ugly loser boys so yeah I'd like them better if they were cute girls instead.

Plus those last cutscenes with Nemona's battle were really sweet

posts.name: Anonymous

>>52646056
>How would you even define that?
I suppose you could gauge it by their number of successful runs vs failures, but that risks being an incomplete metric unless somebody streams literally every run live.
Without extra restrictions that's also not too meaningful though, since without a level cap you can just grind a team to 100 and sweep anyway. And once you have a level cap you'd want to account for other metrics like how many mons they lost or how much time they spent.

Strictly speaking, being a professional just means they're being paid for it, which at best is going to be indirect if they're a streamer or youtuber. 'Expert' might be a better qualifier, but is even more vague.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
I am working on my fan game since 2014. I tried recruiting people, but no one joined, so I sucked it up and worked alone for years.

The game is a two parter called Enjoy the Silence and Hard Lessons. It takes place in a school, but, unlike Gen 9, the school is actually important for the story.

Basically, the overarching plot is that there will be a tournament where all schools in the region send their very best to compete. The first game is about you trying to be the best on your school, making friends and enemies, and the second game will be about you finally going to said tournament and tying loose ends of the first game.

You can see some progress here: https://vm.tiktok.com/ZMFsSG1U6/

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com: Making an open world Pokémon game about you being a bounty hunter hired by some mysterious organization to infiltrate an island belonging to another mysterious organization and retrieve a person with an ancient artifact. The game is open world like cockslayer’s crystal clear. You start in one tutorial dungeon, which then opens up to the rest of the game. The enemy commanders (this game’s equivalent to gym leaders) are all bastardizations of figures of the Pokémon community. Example Pulfrick is based off of wolvey glick, or Cockslayer being shockslayer. Even some other figures based off of people like Jaiden and SHF will be in the game as mid bosses, but didn’t make the cut for commander status. The enemies don’t exactly scale to your level, although they level up based on the amount of commanders defeated. Defeating commanders and doing other stuff can even get you items and access to either shortcuts, or access to secret areas, which either have static levels, or have a minimum level, and level up with defeated commanders. I have a lot of the groundwork set up, although I am waiting for gen 9 stuff to come out because it will overwrite a lot of the stuff I am doing, and I really want a lot of that stuff. EV’s and IV’s will be removed, not to mention level grinding will not take too long even without debug. I’ll also try to limit over leveling. Especially with how the island works, I probably won’t be able to cram in all 1010 Pokémon, but I can try to get in as many as I can. I will also not include any megas, z moves, dynamax, or terestrializing. There will be an enemy exclusive gimmick to make fights more unique and thoughtful.

The raymond economy was born specifically because he didn't have an amiibo card when the game launched, Because Nintendo seem to hate making money they didn't bother to release Amiibo cards for the 8 new villagers until way later in the game's life cycle. posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52646549
But their way of going about it is stripping away Pokemon's appeal as a competitive game.
The big thing that sets Pokemon apart is the massive quantity of options available to you, allowing for nearly infinite creativity.
Smogon doesn't want that. They want people to use the same handful of mons that do the same things. They want battles to consist of flowcharts and long switching chains and clicking status moves to try and fish for progress.
They refuse to accept that the meta is changing toward different playstyles being dominant.
If gen 5 came out now, weather would've been banned because it's too offensively strong.
If gen 6 came out now, Fairy-types would've been banned because Smogon wouldn't want to re-learn the type chart.
If gen 7 came out now, Z-moves would've been banned because it forces too many 50/50's.

Competition is about innovation and trying to be better than your opponent. Smogon is about stagnation and trying to stop your opponent from being better than you.
They've lost the plot and are stuck in their ways.
